question.title: Classes more than 5 students
question.content:
There is a table courses with columns: student and class

Please list out all classes which have more than or equal to 5 students.

For example, the table:

+---------+------------+
| student | class      |
+---------+------------+
| A       | Math       |
| B       | English    |
| C       | Math       |
| D       | Biology    |
| E       | Math       |
| F       | Computer   |
| G       | Math       |
| H       | Math       |
| I       | Math       |
+---------+------------+

Should output:

+---------+
| class   |
+---------+
| Math    |
+---------+

rephrased.body: Given a table `courses` with columns `student` and `class`, identify and list all classes that have five or more students enrolled.

testcases.input:
Table: courses
+---------+------------+
| student | class      |
+---------+------------+
| A       | Math       |
| B       | English    |
| C       | Math       |
| D       | Biology    |
| E       | Math       |
| F       | Computer   |
| G       | Math       |
| H       | Math       |
| I       | Math       |
+---------+------------+
testcases.explanation: The 'Math' class has 6 students (A, C, E, G, H, I), which is greater than or equal to 5.  The other classes have fewer than 5 students, so they are not included in the output.
No class has 5 or more students. Therefore, the output is an empty table.

testcases.input:
Table: courses
+---------+------------+
| student | class      |
+---------+------------+
| A       | Math       |
| B       | Math       |
| C       | Math       |
| D       | Math       |
| E       | Math       |
| F       | English       |
| G       | English       |
| H       | English       |
| I       | English       |
| J       | English       |
| K       | Computer       |
+---------+------------+
testcases.explanation: Both 'Math' and 'English' have 5 or more students. Math has (A, B, C, D, E) i.e. 5. English has (F, G, H, I, J) i.e. 5. Computer has only one student, so it's excluded.
